results.title: The Dreaming reels. Vol. 2 (A)
results.creator_credit: National Film and Sound Archive of Australia
results.brief_description: Volume II of a two volume set compiled by the National Film and Sound Archive (now ScreenSound Australia) containing a selection of silent Australian films, both factual and fictional, that focus on representations of Aboriginal peoples. This volume contains two feature length documentaries. “Coorab in the Island of ghosts” is believed to have been made from ethnographic footage shot on an early expedition by adventurer and overlander Francis Birtles. The material was edited and narrative intertitles added to give a ‘docudrama’ style, white interpretation of the life and tribal activities of an Aboriginal named Coorab, who lived around Cape York in Northern Australia. Despite its patronising tone the film presents a vivid picture of Aboriginal tribal life. “The Native problem in Queensland” is a silent documentary that was made for the Queensland Government which shows traditional tribal life and State institutions. It discusses the Government’s policy towards the native peoples of the state and is an official record of patrols to Queensland and Torres Strait reserves and missions by the Hon. E.M. Hanlon, Minister for Health and Home Affairs.

results.title: The Dreaming reels. Vol. 1 (A)
results.creator_credit: National Film and Sound Archive of Australia
results.brief_description: Volume I of a two volume set compiled by the National Film and Sound Archive (now ScreenSound) containing a selection of early Australian films, both factual and fictional, that focus on representations of Aboriginal peoples. Early adventurers, explorers, scientists and ethnographers used motion picture cameras to record their travels in far flung reaches of Australia and their encounters with Aboriginal peoples often living traditional tribal lifestyles. The surviving footage reveals as much about the filmmakers as the subjects and expresses the prevailing attitudes of the day. Highlights include the Haddon expedition to the Torres Strait (possibly the world’s first ethnographic film in 1898) ; The Lake Tyres Aboriginal Settlement (1912) ; The Northwest Scientific and Exploration Syndicate in the Kimberley and North Western regions of Western Australia (1917) ; Australia’s first National Highway and the Aboriginal camp at Orbost (1921) ; The wonderland of West Australia, The Douglas Wylie Expedition (1926) ; Natives of Princess Charlotte Bay (Qld) filmed by South Australiam Museum (1926-27) ; Round Australia with the MacRobertson Expedition (1928). Seven feature films are represented with excerpts from “Moth of Moonbi”(1926), “The Enemy within” (1918), “Robbery under arms” (1920), “The Romance of Runnibede” (1927-28), “Trooper O’Brien” (1928), “The Birth of White Australia” and “The Tenth Straw”. Project consultant, Justine Saunders ; music, Jeff Evans.

results.title: The Dreaming age = Meng huan shi jie
results.creator_credit: Children's Film Studio (China) and Lin Hongtong
results.brief_description:
Little Luo Fei, a middle-school student, is affected deeply by the changes brought about in her family by the arrival of Hua Guang, a famous musician and her mother’s erstwhile boyfriend.

Credits: Director, Lin Hongtong.
Cast: Wang Chunzi, Lou Jicheng

results.title: The Dreaming
results.creator_credit: FGH Film Consortium, International Film Management, Genesis Films, Craig Lahiff, Wayne Groom and Mario Andreacchio
results.brief_description: Two hundred years ago bands of whalers roamed the oceans. In the Great Southern Land of Australia they discovered natives who cherished a mystical power called the Dreaming - a knowledge handed down from the beginning of their world. The whalers were bloodthirsty men, responsible for rapes killings and massacres - a taint upon the Dreaming. This taint lives on into the present and a new nightmare when a burial ground is unearthed, a girl dies, an ancient curse is revived and a young doctor becomes inextricably involved in a chain of supernatural events that point towards death. Starring Arthur Dignam, Penny Cook, Gary Sweet, Laurence Clifford and Kristina Nehm. Based on a story by Craig Lahiff and Terry Jennings.

results.title: The Dreaming
results.creator_credit: Collings Productions, Dahl Collings and Geoffrey Collings
results.brief_description: In this description of the rock paintings of the Australian Aborigine an attempt has been made to create something of the feeling of reverence and awe these people had for the supernatural powers and works of their spirit ancestors.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Collings Productions, Dahl Collings and Geoffrey Collings

results.title: The Dream valley
results.brief_description: Originally titled “Soria-Moria”, this film, capturing the mood of the Norwegian countryside, recalls Sucksdorff’s earlier film “Wind from the west”. This film explores the mountains and waterfalls round the fiord Soria-Moria, through the eyes of a small girl. The images capture an attractive atmosphere of space, air and ruggedness characteristic of the northern regions of Norway.

results.title: The Dream (Week 2)
results.creator_credit: Seven Network Limited (Australia), Todd Abbott and Colin Bromley
results.brief_description: A more lighthearted approach to the Games of the 27th Olympiad held in Sydney. Highlights from the television program ‘The Dream with Roy and HG’ (John Doyle and Greig Pickhaver) which ran nightly for the duration of the games. Includes highlights of events and interviews with popular Olympians - both past and present. Features Roy and HG’s special comments on Greco-Roman wrestling, gymnastics, weightlifting, synchronized swimming, diving, taekwondo, boxing and equestrian dressage. Newsbreak with Bardot, Marcia Hines, Billie Jean King, Yvonne Kenny, Sam Riley as well as special guest appearances by Matt Welsh, Hayley Lewis, Gary Hall Jnr, Natalie Cook, Kerrie Pottharst, Todd Woodbridge, Mark Woodford and Tatiana Grigorieva.

results.title: The Dream (Week 1)
results.creator_credit: Seven Network Limited (Australia), Todd Abbott and Colin Bromley
results.brief_description: A more lighthearted approach to the Olympic Games. Highlights from the television progam ‘The Dream with Roy and HG’ (John Doyle and Greig Pickhaver) which ran nightly for the duration of the Sydney Olympic Games. Includes highlights of events and interviews with popular Olympians - both past and present. This tape shows highlights of week one including Eric Moussambini’s historic solo 100 metre swim, the Russian Gymnastics, diving, rowing and judo finals.

results.title: The Drawings of Leonardo Da Vinci (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: BFI, Basil Wright and Adrian de Potier
results.brief_description: Drawings and notes of Leonardo da Vinci from the Royal Collection at Windsor Castle, the Royal Academy and the British Museum with some comment and explanation, to celebrate the quincentenary of Leonardo’s birth. Narrated by Sir Laurence Olivier.
results.creator_credit_for_label: BFI, Basil Wright and Adrian de Potier
